001package calibration_demos_more;
002
003import java.awt.Color;
004
005import ij.IJ;
006import ij.ImagePlus;
007import ij.ImageStack;
008import ij.io.LogStream;
009import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
010import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
011import imagingbook.calibration.data.zhang.ZhangData;
012import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.Camera;
013import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.ViewTransform;
014import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
015import imagingbook.lib.util.ResourceUtils;
016
017
018/**
019 * This plugin projects and draws the projected X/Y/Z coordinate axes
020 * for each of the given camera views.
021 * 
022 * @author W. Burger
023 * @version 2017-05-30
024 */
025public class Demo_Draw_3D_Axes implements PlugIn {
026
027        static Class<?> resourceRootClass = ZhangData.class;
028        static String resourceDir = "resources/";
029        static String resourceName = "CalibImageStack.tif";
030
031        static Color BackGroundColor = Color.white;
032        static Color LineColor = Color.magenta;
033        static Color xColor = Color.red;
034        static Color yColor = Color.green;
035        static Color zColor = Color.blue;
036
037        static double axisLength = 5;   
038        static boolean BeVerbose = false;
039
040        static {
041                LogStream.redirectSystem();
042                PrintPrecision.set(6);
043        }
044
045        public void run(String arg0) {
046                // create a 3D model:
047
048                double[] p0 = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0}; // 3D origin
049                double[] p1 = {axisLength, 0.0, 0.0};
050                double[] p2 = {0.0, axisLength, 0.0};
051                double[] p3 = {0.0, 0.0, axisLength};
052
053                // open the test image (stack):
054                ImagePlus testIm = ResourceUtils.openImageFromResource(resourceRootClass, resourceDir, resourceName);
055                if (testIm == null) {
056                        IJ.error("Could not open calibration images!");
057                        return;
058                }
059                testIm.show();
060
061                // get the camera intrinsics (typically by calibration):
062                Camera camera = ZhangData.getCameraIntrinsics();
063
064                // get all view parameters (extrinsics):
065                ViewTransform[] views = ZhangData.getAllViewTransforms();
066                int M = views.length;
067
068                // project and draw the model into the views:
069                ImageStack stack = testIm.getStack();
070                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
071                        ImageProcessor ip = stack.getProcessor(i + 1);
072                        ip.setColor(xColor);
073                        drawProjectedSegment(ip, camera, views[i], p0, p1);
074                        ip.setColor(yColor);
075                        drawProjectedSegment(ip, camera, views[i], p0, p2);
076                        ip.setColor(zColor);
077                        drawProjectedSegment(ip, camera, views[i], p0, p3);
078                }
079                testIm.updateAndDraw();
080        }
081
082        private void drawProjectedSegment(ImageProcessor ip, Camera cam, ViewTransform V, double[] P1, double[] P2) {
083                double[] u1 = cam.project(V, P1);
084                int u1x = (int) Math.round(u1[0]);
085                int u1y = (int) Math.round(u1[1]);
086                double[] u2 = cam.project(V, P2);
087                int u2x = (int) Math.round(u2[0]);
088                int u2y = (int) Math.round(u2[1]);
089                ip.drawLine(u1x, u1y, u2x, u2y);
090        }
091
092
093}
